events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and damage description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to facilitate communication and assist the customer.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the customer's auto accident claim.
Requested the customer to submit the police report and photographs of the vehicle damage for further assessment.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the accident police report and photos of the damaged car.
Investigation into the accident details and liability of involved parties has officially commenced.
The investigation concluded that the other driver was at fault, enabling the claim to progress.
A settlement amount covering the vehicle repairs and medical expenses was proposed to the claimant.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the handling.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company following positive feedback from the customer.
Insurance payment for the agreed settlement was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account without delay.
The claim was officially closed after the payment was confirmed and all procedures were completed.
All claim documents and records were archived in the company system for future reference and compliance.
